title: LLMs for General Audience
description: Andrej Karpathy's series provides a comprehensive introduction to Large Language Models, covering their development, capabilities, and practical applications in an accessible manner.
longDescription: Andrej Karpathy's YouTube series for a general audience focuses on explaining Large Language Models (LLMs) in an accessible way. His comprehensive videos cover topics such as the training process of LLMs, tokenization, neural network internals, and practical applications. He also discusses the limitations and future directions of these models, including the need for advanced reinforcement learning techniques. The content is designed to empower viewers to understand and effectively use the latest AI technologies.
prerequisite: LLMs, General AI knowledge, Generative AI

title: Advanced NLP
description: This course covers advanced NLP concepts using neural networks.
longDescription: The course provides a comprehensive overview of modern NLP methods, focusing on neural networks and their applications. It covers topics such as syntactic, semantic, and discourse analysis, retrieval-augmented generation, and fairness in NLP models. The course culminates in a project where students reimplement and improve upon a research paper.
prerequisite: Python, Probability, Linear Algebra, and basic neural networks

title: Natural Language Processing with Deep Learning
description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of NLP with deep learning methods.
longDescription: This course provides a thorough introduction to cutting-edge research in deep learning applied to NLP. The course focuses on neural networks, which are a class of deep learning models that have recently obtained improvements in many different NLP tasks.

title: Neural Networks: Zero to Hero
description: This course covers the fundamentals of neural networks, starting from scratch and progressing to advanced models like GPT.
longDescription: The course begins with the basics of backpropagation and builds up to multi-layer perceptrons (MLPs), convolutional neural networks (CNNs), and modern deep neural networks such as generative pre-trained transformers (GPTs). It also covers diagnostic tools for understanding neural network dynamics and performance, as well as tokenization and byte-pair encoding (BPE). The focus is on language models, but the skills learned are transferable to other areas like computer vision.

title: Deep Learning for Computer Vision
description: This course covers neural-network-based deep learning methods for computer vision.
longDescription: The course provides a deep dive into neural networks for visual recognition tasks such as image classification and object detection. Students learn to implement, train, and debug their own neural networks and gain a detailed understanding of cutting-edge research in computer vision. Topics include learning algorithms, neural network architectures, and practical engineering tricks for training and fine-tuning networks.
prerequisite: Python, basic linear algebra, and calculus

title: Multimodal Machine Learning
description: This course covers fundamental mathematical concepts in multimodal machine learning, including representation, alignment, and fusion across different modalities.
longDescription: The course addresses the challenges of integrating multiple communicative modalities such as linguistic, acoustic, and visual messages. It focuses on six main challenges: representation, alignment, reasoning, generation, transference, and quantification. Topics include multimodal transformers, neuro-symbolic models, and multimodal tensor fusion. Applications discussed include multimodal affect recognition, image and video captioning, and language-vision navigation.
prerequisite: Python, basic machine learning and deep learning

title: Introduction to Deep Learning
description: This course provides an introduction to deep learning techniques, focusing on neural networks and their applications in language technologies.
longDescription: The course covers the fundamentals of neural networks, including feedforward, convolutional, and recurrent architectures. It explores how these models are applied in various tasks related to language technologies, such as natural language processing and speech recognition. Students gain hands-on experience with deep learning tools and frameworks.

title: Large Language Model Agents MOOC
description: This course provides a comprehensive overview of LLM agents, covering foundational concepts, essential abilities, and real-world applications.
longDescription: The course begins with the foundation of large language models (LLMs) and explores their essential abilities for task automation. It delves into LLM agent infrastructure, retrieval-augmented generation, and various applications such as code generation, robotics, web automation, medical applications, and scientific discovery. The course also addresses privacy, safety, ethics, human-agent interaction, and multi-agent collaboration. Industry leaders provide guest lectures, offering insights into the latest developments and challenges in the field.
prerequisite: Basic understanding of AI and programming

title: Neural Networks - 3Blue1Brown
description: This series visually explains the basics of neural networks, including how they learn and process information.
longDescription: The series covers the structure and mathematical description of neural networks, starting with simple neurons and progressing to complex networks. It explores how neural networks learn from data using gradient descent and how they can be applied to tasks like image recognition.

title: The Essence of Linear Algebra - 3Blue1Brown
description: This series provides a visual introduction to linear algebra, focusing on matrices, transformations, and vector spaces.
longDescription: The series covers foundational concepts such as vectors, linear combinations, and matrix transformations. It emphasizes visualizing these concepts to deepen understanding, including topics like determinants, eigenvectors, and abstract vector spaces.

title: The Essence of Calculus - 3Blue1Brown
description: This series visually explains the core ideas of calculus, focusing on derivatives, integrals, and limits.
longDescription: The series aims to make calculus seem discoverable by emphasizing intuitive visual explanations. It covers topics such as the power rule, chain rule, and fundamental theorem of calculus, using geometric and intuitive approaches.
